results.title: Bean
results.creator_credit: Mel Smith, Tim Evans, Eric Fellner, Peter Bennett-Jones, NV Polygrams S A and PolyGram Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: In an attempt to get rid of their most inept and detested employee, Mr Bean, The Royal National Gallery of London send him to America to oversee the unveiling of America’s most treasured painting, ‘Whistler’s mother’. The staff of the Grierson Gallery in Los Angeles are not privy to the gallery’s rationale for sending Mr Bean, and still believe that they are dealing with a man of the finest intellect, the scholarly Dr Bean. While in America Mr Bean is billetted to stay with David Langley (Peter MacNicol), much to the annoyance of his family who seriously doubt his supposedly brilliant credentials. As Mr Bean unleashes his particular brand of behaviour, which inevitably ends in disaster, they too begin to wonder about the enigmatic Mr Bean. The most significant of his disasters includes destroying ‘Whistlers’ mother’, forcing him into panic mode to rectify the situation before he gives a speech at the grand unveiling. Cast also includes Mel Smith, Pamela Reed and Harris Yulin. Includes 20 minutes of unseen footage as well as interviews with Rowan Atkinson and Mel Smith.

results.title: Bayi Gardiya (Singing Desert)
results.credit_line:
Creative technology studio: Nakatomi
Performed by Christian Thompson
Composed by Christian Thompson and Mark Mitchell
Sound production by Mark Mitchell at Electric Dreams Studio
With special thanks to Rachael Sheridan, Jeanette Little and Leyla Varela
results.material_description: 360 degree video, VR system, headphones, sand and AIATSIS map of Indigenous Australia
results.brief_description:
Bayi Gardiya (Singing Desert) is an immersive, 360 degree moving image and sound experience.

The environment within Bayi Gardiya situates a visitor in the creek bed of The Sixth Mile, Barcaline, western Queensland. The imagery and sound within transforms from morning to midday and then to twilight and night. These transitions also shift through seasonal change to represent and also comment on the impacts of Global Warming on the fragile, semi-desert Hinterland and country represented in the work.

results.title: Beach
results.brief_description: Multi-layered interactive work using both still and moving images of Bells Beach, Point Addis and a beach cave. A beautifully constructed meditative piece accompanied by the sounds of nature.

results.title: Baxter earns his wings
results.creator_credit: Don Arioli, Roman Kroitor, Rosemarie Shapley, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Taking the roles of different characters, two actors perform the life story of a person called Baxter. The various significant stages of Baxter’s life, his death and his acceptance into heaven are performed. This delightful production has no dialogue but is accompanied by the actors’ own sound effects. Patrice Arbour stars as Baxter and Bernard Carez as all other characters.

results.title: Be careful boys
results.creator_credit: Keith Learner, Nancy Hanna, Vera Linnecar, Oliver Lawson Dick and Biographic Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Charlie Burke is a wilfully careless handler of fruit, and is generally unpopular with his fellow workers, the foreman, the producers, the fruiterers and the housewives. A visit to a psychoanalyst reforms him. He acquires a conscience and becomes a model handler, self respecting and respected.

results.title: Bauhaus: face of the twentieth century
results.creator_credit: Julia Cave, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description: The development, key figures involved and the historical, political and economic context of the Bauhaus school of architecture, design, and craftsmanship is detailed in this program with narration by Frank Whitford. It is a comprehensive historical and analytical study of the movement which was a turning point in European and then world-wide thought on varied facets of design through its integration of notions of design, industry and functionality. This relationship created designs, buildings, art works and performance art synonymous with rationalised, sharp-edged and industry machine based ideals, which are closely analysed in this program from its development in the early 1900s to the struggles of the revolutionary aims of those involved during the Nazi regime and its contemporary influence. It presents a collection of archival footage, interviews with relevant experts as well as its students and teachers and the representation and discussion of an array of exemplary works and achieves a thorough outline of the Bauhaus school and its impact on modern design and architecture.

results.title: Battlestar Galactica [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Richard Colla, Leslie Stevens, John Dykstra and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: There are those who believe that life here began out there with tribes of humans who may have been the forefathers of The Egyptians, or the Toltecs, or the Mayans. That they may have been the architects of the Great Pyramids or the lost civilizations of Lemuria, or Atlantis. Some believe that there may yet be brothers of man who even now fight to survive somewhere beyond the Heavens. The Alliance, supported by the cyber-mechanical Cylon Empire, and the Twelve Colonies of Man have finally agreed to set aside their differences and to sign a peace treaty negotiated by Count Baltar that will end a conflict that has been raging for a thousand years. However, while on a routine reconnaissance mission in his Viper, fighter pilot Apollo finds evidence that the treaty is in fact a trap for the unsuspecting Colonies. Dogged by a contingent of Cylon Raiders, he warns Adama, Commander of the Battlestar Galactica of the deception, but the President of the Colonies, under Baltar’s treacherous influence, fails to act. As a result, all of the defending battlestars succumb to Cylon attack, with only the Galactica surviving the carnage. As the Cylons systematically begin to destroy the Colonies, Adama rounds up all the survivors, and the motley fleet set off in search of the legendary thirteenth colony, Earth. However, starvation soon takes its toll on the survivors, and the fleet are forced to stop at the mining planet Carillon. The insectoid Ovian inhabitants offer hospitality to the refugees, but Adama is suspicious of the riches that seem too freely available, and sends Apollo and Starbuck to keep an eye on proceedings. While attending a special event celebrating peace on the planet’s surface, they make a terrifying discovery that could bring about the apocalyptic elimination of every last human in the galaxy. This film, derived from the first three hour pilot episode of the short-lived cult TV series of the same name, stars Lorne Green as Adama, Richard Hatch as Apollo, Dirk Benedict as Starbuck, Jane Seymour as Serina, and Noah Hathaway as Boxey.

constellations_other.name: Beyond the game industry
constellations_other.description: While the game industry garners a lot of publicity, digital games have long been created outside the official industry, and the social and cultural significance of games has always exceeded official channels.

results.title: BBC Children's favourites
results.brief_description: A fun compilation of BBC favourites for children as seen on ABC television. Spend a happy hour with the Fimbles, the Tweenies, Bill and Ben, Andy Pandy, Angelmouse, Yoho Ahoy and the Teletubbies.

results.title: Battleground
results.creator_credit: William Wellman, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: It is the dead of winter and GIs are dug in near the strategic crossroads of Bastogne. They are surrounded, outnumbered and bombarded with a steady barrage of incoming fire. Ammunition is low and it looks as if the fog will never lift. The Germans, sensing victory, demand surrender - and receive a strong reply from the American commander. Winner of the Best Screenplay and Best Cinematography Academy Awards, this movie is a landmark portrait of triumph under fire dedicated to the honour all soldiers and resonates with the humour, fear and bravery of civilian soldiers put to the test in the greatest conflict the world has ever known.

results.title: Battle of Australia
results.creator_credit: Les Neale, Kim MacDonald and Today's Territory
results.brief_description: As an island nation, Australia was fortunate to be untouched by the ravages of war that shook Europe and Asia during World War 2, until the bombing of Darwin. For the first time in our recorded history, the horror of international conflict reached our shore. Australia’s isolation was no longer a guarantee of protection. This video presents historical footage of the dramatic events of the Japanese attack.
